meanings.definition: Yerks (verb): to move suddenly or forcefully
meanings.sent1: She yerks the door open when she's in a hurry.
meanings.sent2: The cat yerks its tail when it's annoyed.
meanings.sent3: He yerks his arm up to catch the ball before it hits the ground.
meanings.sent4: The wind yerks the leaves off the trees in a wild dance.
meanings.sent5: The sudden yerks of the roller coaster made her scream with excitement.

meanings.definition: Yerks (noun): a sudden or forceful movement
meanings.sent1: The earthquake caused a yerks that shook the entire building.
meanings.sent2: The yerks of the car as it hit the pothole startled the passengers.
meanings.sent3: His yerks on the dance floor were so energetic, everyone stopped to watch.
meanings.sent4: The yerks of the waves crashing against the shore sounded like thunder.
meanings.sent5: The sudden yerks of the train made her spill her drink all over herself.
